JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born respectively in DATE and DATE . Both applicants were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr Vladimir Grosu .

As with the applicants in the pilot judgment of ORG and others ( ORG and others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) , the applicants in the instant cases complained of a breach of their rights guaranteed under LAW and under LAW as a result of the authorities’ failure to comply with final judicial decisions delivered by domestic courts in their favour .
By a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ruled in favour of PERSON and ordered ORG , together with ORG and the NORP local authorities , to provide him with accommodation .
By a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ruled in favour of Mr PERSON and ordered ORG , together with ORG and the NORP local authorities , to provide him with accommodation .

On DATE Mr PERSON signed a contract by which the NORP local authorities handed over to him property rights in respect of an apartment situated in GPE . The contract was registered with the cadastral authorities on DATE .
On DATE Mr PERSON signed a similar contract in respect of another apartment situated in GPE . The contract was registered with the cadastral authorities on DATE .

Following communication of the applications , on DATE the Government informed the ORG that the final judgments in favour of PERSON PERSON and PERSON PERSON had been enforced , respectively , on DATE and DATE . The Government also attached copies of sale contracts signed by the applicants and other relevant documents .
